learning_outcomes.description: Critically investigate and evaluate the history and contemporary cultural impact of automation
Analyse automation from  a variety of historical, philosophical, aesthetic, sociological, technological and political perspectives
Communicate effectively about the key debates and scholarship in the study of automation
Think and write critically about the cultural impact of automation on everyday life, drawing on key debates and scholarship

assessments.due_date:
29/07/2025 - 23/10/2025

You must attend your tutorial to complete that week’s activity, unless you have a medical certificate or relevant Student Access Plan.
assessments.task_description:
Assessed weekly in-class, or online, from week 1 to week 12 (no tutorials week 5 or 9). Worth 20%. 

Each week you will complete a different in-class activity during your tutorial. You must attend your tutorial to complete that week’s activity, unless you have a medical certificate or relevant Student Access Plan. You must complete at least 5 tutorial exercises to pass this assignment.

Your workshop instructions will be provided each week in your Learning Resources folder. 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Your workshop instructions will be provided each week in your Learning Resources folder.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You must attend your tutorial to complete that week’s activity, unless you have a medical certificate or relevant Student Access Plan.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
Please contact your tutor directly if you need to reschedule your in-class discussion session. 

Please note: this is an in-class assessment item and students are NOT able to apply for an extension via the Unitask portal.
assessments.task_description:
Task Description:

Worth 20%. You will be allocated a week in which to lead a class discussion in your week 1 tutorial. You must submit a written reflection within one week (before the following tutorial). 

Submit your written reflection via Turnitin. 

Need help submitting your assignment? https://web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/it/learnuq-blackboard-help/learnuq-assessment/turnitin-assignments

Please contact your tutor directly if you need to reschedule your in-class discussion session. 

Please note: this is an in-class assessment item and students are NOT able to apply for an extension via the Unitask portal. 

Further information is available in your Assessment 2 folder in the COMU3025 Blackboard site

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your written reflection via Turnitin. The submission portal is in your Assessment 2 folder on the course Blackboard site
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Due Friday September 26 at 4pm. Worth 25%.

You will write a 1000 word field report a media analysis on a topic of your choice . You can include images, embed video and link sound files in this assessment.

Submission portal, detailed task description and marking criteria are available your Assessment 3 folder in the course Blackboard site. Please note: the portal is scheduled to open 10 days before the deadline. It is not recommended to complete your assignment before finishing module 2 of the course. 

Need help submitting your assignment?  https://web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/it/learnuq-blackboard-help/learnuq-assessment/turnitin-assignments

If you need to apply for an extension, please follow the directions found here:  https://my.uq.edu.au/node/218/0#0

Further information can be found in your "Assessment 3" folder on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission portal is available your Assessment 3 folder in the course Blackboard site. Please note: the portal is scheduled to open 10 days before the deadline. It is not recommended to complete your assignment before finishing module 2 of the course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Due Friday 31 October at 4pm. Worth 35%

You have a choice between writing a 1500 word research essay about automation and its cultural effects, using an example of which you have first-hand knowledge OR undertaking a creative project—such as a podcast, zine, short story, film script—that creatively engages with the course content on cultures of automation, accompanied by a short written reflection.

Submission portal, detailed task description and marking criteria are available in this folder. Please note: the portal is scheduled to open 10 days before the deadline. It is not recommended to complete your assignment before finishing module 2 of the course. 

Need help submitting your assignment?  https://web.library.uq.edu.au/library-services/it/learnuq-blackboard-help/learnuq-assessment/turnitin-assignments

If you need to apply for an extension, please follow the directions found here:  https://my.uq.edu.au/node/218/0#0
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission portal is available your Assessment 4 folder on the course Blackboard site. Please note: the portal is scheduled to open 10 days before the deadline. It is not recommended to complete your assignment before finishing module 3 of the course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
